page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The area covered by our survey is to the{N}and{NW}of{Tewkesbury.}The area is divided by the{R.Avon}which can only be crossed to the{S}at Tewkesbury or 5 kilometeres to the{NW}at {Eckington.}To the{E}of the river we have looked at a small corner of the village of{Bredon,}and to the{W}the straggling village of{Twyning,}and the settlements at{Shuthonger}and the {Mythe.}The entire area forms part of the flood plain of the{Avon,}the Mythe being the only point higher than 46 meters, and most of the land is under intensive cultivation. Some flooding occurs, mostly on the E bank. Twyning is largely a dormitory village, most people commuting to local towns where skilled work in light industry is available. A small minority are employed in the traditional industry of market gardening.
